text: my name is Lynn forcus and I'm the
founder of hope camp I started hope him
in 2002 when my nine-year-old son Matt
was diagnosed with leukemia
and at the toughest time of his life
when he needed to be with his friends at
most he was stuck at home going through
treatment the biggest challenge was with
kids that have cancer
is loneliness and isolation in order for
the chemotherapy to work they have to
suppress their immune system they can't
go to school because they can't take the
risk of kitchen cold as a dad I wanted
to do anything I could to help him feel
less lonely so we put a web camera in
his classroom and one during our home
and you should have been in the room
when those two cameras clicked on and my
son could see his friends and they could
see him those 24 kids in the classroom
saw my son go through treatment in
real-time they saw the changes they saw
his face ballooning up from the steroids
his hair fall out by putting a web
camera in my son's classroom and one on
her home we were able to bridge this
deep divide between my son's loneliness
and the classroom where his friends were
what deep lense has the opportunity to
do is to build on that foundation and
take it to a whole new level the deep
lens health challenge has a huge
opportunity to help Hope Camp just from
the visibility for people to see what we
do but also for every submission Pope
cam gets a benefit I'm really excited
about the deep lense health challenge
just to see what the development
community can come up with to change the
lives and improve the health of so many
people
[Music]
